intro: Dunalia cyanea, commonly known as the blue dunalia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the bean or legume family. The plant is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers, which are typically clustered in racemes. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets. Dunalia cyanea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
